sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'; export default function Portfolio(props) { return (
Background

Perhaps it's a bit indulgent to post my portfolio as a project on my portfolio. However, I spent a fair amount of time contemplating what an optimized portfolio would look like so I mostly want to discuss...

I think part of being a good developer is spending the time to give some thought towards the question of "What is the point/goal of a project?" To me, it seems the point of a portfolio is to provide easily accessible insight into the capabilities of a developer, but also importantly, into the thought process of a developer.

I have been spending a lot of time looking at job applications. Most of them ask for some combo of links to the applicant's GitHub, LinkedIn, and personal website.

  • GitHub is a showcase of the hard technical skills and pure code.
  • LinkedIn is a summary of work experience.
It struck me that there was a relevant middle ground being missed somewhere between these two "extremes" - somewhere where technical knowledge could be displayed alongside a summary of the motivation that was guiding how that technical knowledge was being put to use.

) }
